metadata.title: CVE-2012-0884 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
The implementation of Cryptographic Message Syntax (CMS) and PKCS #7 inOpenSSL before 0.9.8u and 1.x before 1.0.0h does not properly restrictcertain oracle behavior, which makes it easier for context-dependentattackers to decrypt data via a Million Message Attack (MMA) adaptivechosen ciphertext attack.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-0884` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libssl1.0.0 - 1.0.1-4ubuntu1
openssl - 1.0.1-4ubuntu1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

libssl0.9.8 - 0.9.8o-7ubuntu3.2.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openssl package in trusty/esm, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.0.1-4ubuntu1').
openssl098 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.9.8o-7ubuntu3.2.14.04.1').
